I tried Simple Contacts and liked it, especially that my contacts were stored on the phone. I went right through my collection of contacts, assigned pictures to each, added an extra GROUP and then curated each contact into the appropriate GROUP category. I deleted the OTHERS and COLLEGES groups, but they insisted on coming right back again! I heeded the warning that the (non-pro) version was no longer supported and splashed out the very reasonable amount requested for the PRO version. BUT: * Almost all of my contacts are now no longer visible. * Of those that remain only three have retained their GROUP allocation. * The extra GROUP that I created is missing. * And STILL the OTHERS and COLLEGES groups can be deleted, but immediately re-appear. It seems that I‚Äôd have been better off sticking with the unsupported vanilla version rather than buying PRO! Nothing has actually been lost though because both version of the APP are still on the phone and are exactly as I want them to be. So the purpose of this review is to alert the APP‚Äôs author to my (less than appreciated) negative experiences, and in the hope that there is a ‚Äújust do this‚Äù solution to save me the effort of repeating the curating all over again. BdH Australia 22-Jan-21

content: Very good app.

Few little teething things to sort out, will cover that in a mo... But main thing is the app did exactly what I've spent all day looking for, revealing which "source" each contact belonged to, and even letting that be changed etc... (It can get confusing for someone who doesn't know about that, especially when a contact is present for two sources, and I had to work out that it was possible to click on the source to edit/delete that row instead of editing the entire contact / default source, but all good.) So, the teething troubles -- beyond confusion mentioned above -- one tiny feature which would be nice would be the filter option to always be on the menu-bar, since I seem to keep on wanting to change that often. Maybe I'm new. FURTHER EDIT -- Yes, the dialler moved to a new app (which I already installed!) and once I'd enabled some extra notifications, it's working... still new, so looking forward to that developing further.

Update May 2020: the "Phone" filter works again BUT the new Dialer doesn't. What is the aim to keep a dialer and a contact app separate - to prevent tracking apps from accessing contacts? Obviously i have given the app the necessary permissions as well as made it the default dialler... What do the developers suggest as solution to this problem?
replyContent: We didnt want to split Contacts and Dialer, but it had to be done due to technical reasons. Google didnt allow accessing the Call Logs which was a hugely requested feature in Contacts. But we couldnt do it and a standalone app had to be published.

I initially had the same issue as noted by others - opening from the shortcut opened v5.x, while form Play it was 6.x.  I looked in my complete list of apps  (via Settings) and found TWO 'Contacts' - I could discern which version was which by that route, and uninstalled the v5.x.  I had to re-create the shortcut, but it now opens 6.x as desired.  All contact information was preserved and seems to be functioning correctly.  The 6.x version evidently does not correctly (or at all) uninstall the earlier version.  Now, a minor quibble - I had already purchased the 'Simple Thank You' app to support the developer, but then had to pay, admittedly not a lot, for the Simple Contacts Pro app.  I like the app (well, at least the previous version - I hope the 'Pro' version doesn't break anything), but I'm knocking off one star for the items above.
